meanings.definition: To move by hopping on one foot.
meanings.sent1: The bunny was hoppling around the garden.
meanings.sent2: She hoppled over the puddle to avoid getting her shoes wet.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo was hoppling so fast, it looked like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The frog hoppled from lily pad to lily pad in the pond.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird was hoppling awkwardly on one leg.

meanings.definition: The act of hopping on one foot.
meanings.sent1: His hoppling was impressive as he balanced on one foot.
meanings.sent2: The hoppling of the flamingo caught the attention of the visitors at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The hoppling competition at the school fair was a fun event for all.
meanings.sent4: The hoppling of the injured squirrel was a sad sight to see.
meanings.sent5: The hoppling of the toddler brought smiles to everyone watching.
